channel.title: DS3 Circuit on 0x000216
channel.description: Recent content in DS3 Circuit on 0x000216

item.title: What Is a DS3 Circuit Or T3 Line?
item.description: Businesses that need more bandwidth than a T1 line often choose DS3. This article explores DS3, its relationship to T3 lines, and competition from Ethernet over Copper. DS3, or Digital Signal level 3, follows standards set by Bell Labs for the telephone industry. The smallest unit, DS0, has a 64 Kbps bandwidth, enough for one digitized phone call using the original digital standard, PCM (Pulse Code Modulation). Combining 24 DS0s creates a DS1, which runs on a T1 line.
